intro: Verbascum wilhelmsianum, commonly known as the Wilhelmsian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
